Books and papers that have shaped my understanding of control and power systems

Currently Reading

Nonlinear Systems (3rd Edition)

Hassan K. Khalil â€¢ Prentice Hall, 2002

The definitive text on nonlinear systems analysis. Currently working through Chapter 4 on Lyapunov stability and its applications to feedback stabilization.

Power System Stability and Control

Prabha Kundur â€¢ McGraw-Hill, 1994

Comprehensive treatment of power system dynamics. Focusing on voltage stability mechanisms and their relationship to load characteristics.

Completed

Optimal Control Theory: An Introduction

Donald E. Kirk â€¢ Dover Publications, 2004

Excellent introduction to variational methods, Pontryagin's maximum principle, and dynamic programming. The examples are particularly well-chosen.

Linear System Theory and Design

Chi-Tsong Chen â€¢ Oxford University Press, 2013

Clear exposition of state-space methods, controllability, observability, and realization theory. Great foundation for advanced control topics.

Key Papers

A Lyapunov Function for Economic Optimizing Model Predictive Control

Angeli, Amrit, & Rawlings â€¢ IEEE TAC, 2012

Elegant proof of stability for economic MPC without terminal constraints.

Voltage Stability of Electric Power Systems

Kundur et al. â€¢ Springer, 1994

Foundational paper on voltage collapse mechanisms and prevention strategies.
